newsitem.title: INDIA: Chidambaram meets Indian businessmen over budget.
newsitem.headline: Chidambaram meets Indian businessmen over budget.

text.p: Finance Minister P. Chidambaram met senior Indian businessmen on Friday for a pre-budget discussion, a government statement said.
It quoted the businessmen as seeking a string of measures to boost industrial growth in the 1997/98 (April-March) budget which Chidambaram is expected to present by late February.
The businessmen sought the following measures from Chidambaram:
* Reduction in customs duties and excise duties on capital goods
* Liberal depreciation rules to encourage investment
* Measures to improve performance by key infrastructure sectors
* Combined limits on pension, provident funds and gratuity for purpose of income tax concessions
* Special encouragement to foreign investments in infrastructure
* Fiscal concessions and duty rationalisations in the steel industry to encourage investments in steel-intensive infrastructure projects
* More liberal policy on external commercial borrowings
* Raising funds through American Depository Receipts (ADRs) should be facilitated
* Introduction of international accounting standards like GAP (General Accounting Practice)
* Reduction in interest rates
* Review MAT (Minimum Alternate Tax)
* Extension of MODVAT (modified value-added tax) to all capital goods, and also to small-scale and medium sized industries
* Allowing buy-back of shares by companies which result in their extinguishing
* Reduction of excise duties in general
* To allow telecom operators to amortise licence fees and to reduce customs duties on telephone instruments particularly cellular phones
* Reduction of excise duties on autmobiles and consumer durables
* Liberalisation of advance ruling for tax assessees and expedite litigation laws and enhancing the time limits for re-opening of old assessments
